reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: PETTYCASH FY16. Communication Materials and Supplies - Miscellaneous Supplies and Materials (NOC) (A, B, C) (ITA) (INS) (FAS). TPC Program Evaluation Specialist JTIP Barnett Ke. INL IT Consumables Replenishment

description.narrative: Combat transnational terrorism, especially from al-Qa'ida, its affiliates, and adherents using a strategic counterterrorism approach that focuses on 1) countering violent extremism; 2) building the capacity of civilian law enforcement and criminal justice institutions to address threats within their own borders; and 3) building stronger relationships with our partners around the world – in order to engage in a broader, more comprehensive counterterrorism effort that treats civilian institutions, to include the justice sector and law enforcement, as a critical part of building effective partner capacity to counter terrorism.

This award strives to combat transnational terrorism, counter violent extremism, build the capacity of civilian law enforcement and criminal justice institutuions, and build stronger relationships with our partners around the world. This includes Post Support[Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified under Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services.]. Post Support PETTYCASH FY16[Covers costs of liquid and hard fuels separate from automotive fuels and purchased utilities. These items are for space heating and for operating of equipment and include fuels for generators, self-generated utilities and bottled gas.]. PETTYCASH FY16[Covers the costs of office supplies, stationary, forms, paper, other supplies, and minor equipment items.]. Post Support[Covers the costs for local and long distance calls based on a rate-per-call basis or on the number of minutes of use under the FTS system.]. PETTYCASH FY16[Covers the cost of supply items not otherwise classified. Includes petty cash purchases as distinguished from specific purpose vouchers.]. PETTYCASH FY16[Covers miscellaneous contractual services such as A&E contracts and IT site preparation by the PBA, GSA, and commercial contracts, among other things.]. Post Support[Covers the costs of office supplies, stationary, forms, paper, other supplies, and minor equipment items.]. PETTYCASH FY16[This transaction covers all other telephone communications costs not otherwise classified.]. PETTYCASH FY16[Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified under Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services.]. PETTYCASH FY16[Covers the costs for local and long distance calls based on a rate-per-call basis or on the number of minutes of use under the FTS system.]. Post Support[This transaction covers all other telephone communications costs not otherwise classified.]. Post Support[Covers the cost of supply items not otherwise classified. Includes petty cash purchases as distinguished from specific purpose vouchers.].

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: In the last few years, Kenya has embarked on a comprehensive and ambitious democratic reform process, including the devolution of government structures and authorities. The goal of devolution is to facilitate a more accountable and participatory system of governance that will allow for broader-based economic growth and improved service delivery at the local level. U.S. assistance in Kenya works across sectors to support this process with an overarching goal of sustainably strengthening regional peace, prosperity and security. These sectors include democracy, human rights and governance; elections in 2017; health including quality and accessibility, infectious diseases, child and maternal health, and water and sanitation; agriculture; private sector competitiveness; education and youth; and environment including biodiversity, adaptation for climate change and combating wildlife trafficking. In addition to participating in several Presidential Initiatives, Kenya is a Relief-to-Development Transition (R2DT) Focus Country and receives assistance to promote resilience and climate adaptation in drought-prone areas.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Counter-Terrorism
